Key Match Events: England defeated Sri Lanka by 4 wickets to end at the second spot in Group 1 table and enter the semi-finals of T20 World Cup on Saturday.
England chased down a target of 142 against Sri Lanka with 4 wickets in hand and two balls to spare.
Ben Stokes remained unbeaten with 42 off 36 balls.
Pathum Nissanka hit a half-century (67 off 45 balls).
Mark Wood took 3 wickets for 26 runs.
Adil Rashid bowled a crucial over in the Powerplay.
Chris Woakes hit the winning boundary.
Pre-Game Insights: Sri Lanka captain Dasun Shanaka won the toss and elected to bat.
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler expressed delight with Ben Stokes' batting and praised Alex Hales for his knock.
Dasun Shanaka felt Sri Lanka could have done better with the bat and praised his team's fight and fielding.
Adil Rashid, the Player of the Match, praised Ben Stokes' knock and expressed relief that England crossed the line.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch played a part in the game, affecting both teams' batting.
Sri Lanka's spinners bowled well, with Wanindu Hasaranga and Dhananjaya de Silva picking up crucial wickets.
Lahiru Kumara used his pace well and bagged two wickets.
England's win knocked Australia out of the tournament.
England will play the semi-final at one of the best stadiums in the world, according to Jos Buttler.
